name: circumscription
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of circumscribing (= limiting something), or the state of being circumscribed: This Act led to the circumscription of presidential powers in the area of foreign policy. He considered this to be a serious circumscription of his political rights.
More examplesFewer examplesThere are always people who are quick to proclaim the injustice of specific circumscriptions. The tumour was typified by asymmetry and poor circumscription.The idea of nationality is by definition bound up with the ideas of circumscription and exclusion.
